definition[0]: to say officially that you want to stop fighting, because you realize that you cannot win
example[1]: The terrorists were given ten minutes to surrender.
definition[1]: to go to the police or the authorities, and say that you want to stop trying to escape from them
example[2]: He immediately surrendered himself to the authorities.
definition[2]: to give up something or someone, especially because you are forced to
example[3]: They agreed to surrender their weapons.
example[4]: She was reluctant to surrender her independence.
example[5]: Marchers who had cameras were forced to surrender their film.
definition[3]: to give something such as a ticket or a passport to an official
example[6]: Steir voluntarily surrendered his license to the State.
definition[4]: to say officially that you want to stop fighting, especially in a war, because you realize that you cannot win – used about people and countries
example[7]: Two days later, the rebels surrendered.
definition[5]: to accept that you cannot win a game, argument, fight etc and stop trying to win it
example[9]: The players refused to give in and eventually won the game 4-3 in extra time.
example[10]: The negotiations went on for days and neither side was prepared to give in.
definition[6]: to accept that you have not won something
example[11]: In July 1905, Russia admitted defeat in its war with Japan.
example[12]: She wanted to run for the Presidency and refused to accept defeat.
definition[7]: to say that you are not going to win a game, argument, election etc, so that it officially ends
example[13]: He was forced to concede the match.
example[14]: Davis conceded defeat in the election.
definition[8]: when you say officially that you want to stop fighting because you realize that you cannot win
example[15]: the humiliation of unconditional surrender  (=accepting total defeat)
example[16]: the Nazis’ surrender to the Allied forces
definition[9]: when you give away something or someone, usually because you are forced to
example[17]: the surrender of all illegal weapons
definition[10]: when you allow yourself to be controlled or influenced by something
definition[11]: if you surrender an insurance policy, you stop it before it MATUREs (=becomes due for payment) and receive only a part of what it would have been worth if you had kept it
example[20]: Many policyholders had held theirannuities for years because of heavy penalties forsurrendering them.
example[21]: The firm paid out $1.33 billion in the first quarter to customerssurrendering insurance policies.
definition[12]: if someone surrenders their power, influence, high position etc, they allow someone else to have it
example[22]: Eight months after taking over the running of the business, shesurrendered thatauthority to a man who had only just joined.
example[23]: He plans tosurrender his majorityownership of the company.
definition[13]: if shares etc surrender their value, price etc, the value, price etc falls
example[24]: Aftersurrendering 39% of itsvalue in the early 1990s, the Nikkei average has moved steadily upwards.
definition[14]: to give something to an official authority when it is asked for
example[25]: Under the Bankruptcy Code, debtors must surrender most of theirassets.
example[26]: The seven men have been granted bail on condition that their passports be surrendered.
definition[15]: the act of stopping an insurance policy before it MATUREs (=becomes due for payment)
example[27]: Last year’s losses follow a flood ofpolicy surrenders.
example[28]: Any profit arising on surrender or maturity will be taken into account.
